fact: 3.34 m is the recorded height of the tallest basil plant.
Ginkgo Biloba is one of the oldest tree species that is alive.
The leaves of the Lucky Bamboo plant grow up to one inch per month.
Cucumber is a fruit and not a vegetable because it has seeds inside.
A Money plant also has seeds. The seeds grow inside the pods, enlarge, and burst fall on the ground.
Banana is actually an Arabic word for fingers.
Many plants are carnivores like the Venus Flytrap and eat tiny little insects and spiders to gain useful nutrients.
There are more than 300,000 plant species identified till date and the list is constantly expanding.
Oak trees do not produce acorns until they become 50 years old.
Avocados and tomatoes are actually fruits.
More than 20% of the world’s oxygen supply is produced by the Amazon Rainforest.
Dandelion can be eaten whole, right from its roots up to the petals.
Apple’s volume consists of 25% air which is why it floats on water.
More than 85% of plant life is found in the ocean.
The first potatoes were cultivated in Peru about 7000 years ago.
The country Brazil is named after a tree.
Plant roots are covered with root hairs that are used to absorb minerals and water.
Water travels in the upward direction from the roots to its stem and then into the plant leaves.
Strawberry is the only fruit that has seeds on the outside. It has about an average of 200 seeds.
96% of raw cucumber and 84% of a raw apple is water.
